participating-org.narrative: CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATION: Community based organization

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training

title.narrative: Colombia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Colombia: Evaluación de resultados de las acciones de inclusión de familias con niñas niños y adolescentes con discapacidad en Familias en Acción (2012-2018)
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF Colombia designed instruments and strengthened capacities to protect school trajectories and improve quality in the learning and the educational continuity , at each level of decision making (i.e. national, departmental and municipal.) UNICEF in collaboration with Corpoeducación supported design of education materials for i) effective classroom interactions between teachers and students; ii) enhancing student's capacities for reading and writing, and iii) strengthening students' expectations regarding school permanence. UNICEF supported training and to enhance teachers capacity on classroom support. | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/01/2020

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available
Percentage of territorial entities certified and prioritized by UNICEF that, along with MEN, implement strategies to ensure timely assistance to children at risk of dropout and/or out of school.
Number of local education authorities, principals and teachers who have acquired knowledge to improve their pedagogical practices, focusing on gender and disability

baseline.value: 280 public servants and trained teachers (Cordoba: 70 50 teachers and 20 public servants. Putumayo: 210 200 teachers and 10 public servants

target.value: 2020:At least 2000 public servants and teachers, already covered in 2019.

title.narrative: Number of educational institutions (EI) in municipalities prioritized by UNICEF that implement innovative pedagogical practices to improve learning in children and teenagers at risk of dropout

baseline.value: Cordoba - 13 EI and 35 branches. Putumayo - 6 EI and 25 branches. Other departments: 0

target.value: 2020:At 64 schools where actions are already underway

title.narrative: Number and percentage of children and teenagers who increase their learning as a result of innovative pedagogical practices

baseline.value: To be determined. There shall be an impact assessment to determine change or improvement in learning of target children and their relationship with implemented pedagogical practices

actual.value: 2019: In 2019 64 educational institutions, the baseline was applied to 4849 children and adolescents to identify the factors that affect their relationship with the school. Learning indicators can only be consulted in March 2020 when the ministry reports results
